videos.title: ClawdBot is the most powerful AI tool I've ever used in my life. Here's how to set it up
videos.creator: Alex Finn
keyInsights: ClawdBot is a 24/7 AI employee that can control your entire computer
Has infinite memory - saves everything you say and do
Interface through Telegram, iMessage, WhatsApp
Claude Opus offers best experience, MiniMax is budget option
Treat it like a new employee - provide detailed info about yourself
VPS recommended for security isolation
Give ClawdBot its own email/accounts for privacy
techniques: Morning briefs with news, weather, tasks
Vibe coding - give access to repos for building features
warnings: Zero guardrails - understand capabilities and risks
Personalization is key for good results

videos.title: LIVE: How I'm using ClawdBot to change my life
videos.creator: Alex Finn
keyInsights: Hardware 'bum rush' predicted within 12 months
Mac Mini recommended over VPS for non-technical users (secure by default)
VPS requires technical security setup
OAuth risk: might get kicked off Claude plan
API keys can cost $200+/month with regular use
Own your hardware for freedom and experimentation
techniques: Reverse Prompting: Ask AI what it can do for you based on what it knows
Use Codec CLI as coding muscle to save Opus tokens
Memory flush prompt for context loss issues
modelAdvice: Use Codec CLI for coding, reserve Opus for brain functions
This is KEY for token optimization

videos.title: Clawdbot/OpenClaw Clearly Explained (and how to use it)

keyInsights: Alex treats Clawdbot as teammate named 'Henry'
Core workflow: Morning brief → Research → Content → Delivery
Henry sends daily morning brief proactively
Researches topics, handles tasks autonomously

videos.title: This is the CHEAPEST and EASIEST way to set up ClawdBot

keyInsights: Host on Amazon EC2 for ~$15-25/month
No Mac Mini required
Ubuntu Linux recommended
30GB storage sufficient
Connect messaging channel (Telegram/WhatsApp/Discord)

keyInsights: Security risks: prompt injections, password/key exposure
Isolate on separate wiped machine or VM
Use Claude Max subscription ($100/mo) not API keys
DGX Spark planned for local models
Grok account connected for powerful X search

Option 2: New isolated computer (MEDIUM RISK - Recommended)

videos.title: ClawdBot The 24/7 AI Agent Employee That Can Automate Your Life!

Can make trades on betting platforms via research
Security: like handing keys to your computer
AWS free tier available for cloud hosting

videos.title: Build Anything with Clawdbot + AntiGravity: Here's How!
videos.creator: Julian Goldie SEO
keyInsights: Clawdbot as orchestrator for multiple AI coding agents
Browser Relay extension for browser control
Claude Opus 4.5 + Gemini 3 Flash combo works well
API choice significantly impacts performance
modelAdvice: More intelligent API = better browser control
Opus 4.5 for brain, Gemini Flash for execution
Cheaper models (GLM, MiniMax) give worse outputs

videos.title: I Tested Clawdbot Against Claude Code: What You Need to Know
videos.creator: Nate Herk | AI Automation
keyInsights: Clawdbot: 9/10 out-of-box ability, persistent memory, no deployment concerns
Claude Code: Better security, proven results, lower risk
900+ exposed Clawdbot servers found with leaked API keys
Never enter API keys in chat - use environment files

hostingOptions: Mac Mini (secure by default, recommended for non-technical)

critical: Don't let others talk to your Clawdbot (root access)
Give Clawdbot its own accounts (not your personal ones)
Never paste API keys in chat - use .env files

morningBrief.description: Daily proactive message with relevant news, weather, tasks

vibeCoding.description: Give repo access, describe features, let it build

workingPrompts.name: Reverse Prompting
workingPrompts.prompt: Based on everything you know about me, what are 5 workflows you could automate for me every day?

workingPrompts.name: Token Optimization
workingPrompts.prompt: Optimize for TPM, split the task into smaller ones, and be cautious

workingPrompts.name: Memory Flush
workingPrompts.prompt: Found in Alex Finn video description - enables memory flush and session memory search

apiBased.warning: Can easily exceed $200/day with heavy use
apiBased.tokens: Token costs add up fast with always-on assistant

costAnalysis.optimization: Use subscription auth, delegate to cheaper models for grunt work

redditTips: Sonnet 4.5 great for conversation, Opus for complex tasks
Clawdbot can launch sub-agents with Opus, Gemini 3 Pro, GPT 5.2
Hybrid workflows: local LLMs for context, Opus for reasoning
99% of what people want can be done with Claude Code + Telegram/WhatsApp interface
securityIncidents: 900+ exposed servers with no password protection
Leaked API keys and chat histories
Default settings meant for local testing deployed online

predictions: Hardware bum rush within 12 months (Alex Finn)
OAuth access may be restricted by AI companies
AI becoming 'operating layer' not just chat tool
trends: Multi-model orchestration essential for cost management
